title: Authors' Pages
content:
[[module css]]
table.wiki-content-table {
  margin: 0;
  width: 100%;
}

table.wiki-content-table td:first-child {
  width: min(15em, 30vw);
} 

.welcome-header {
  font-size: 200%;
  font-weight: bold;
  color: #600;
  text-align: center;
}
.welcome-header span {
  word-break: normal;
}
[[/module]]

[[div class="welcome-header"]]
**WELCOME TO THE SCP FOUNDATION**
[[size 140%]]**AUTHOR PAGE REPOSITORY**[[/size]]
[[/div]]

[[div class="blockquote" style="padding-bottom: 1em;"]]
This page lists author pages created by people who've written for the SCP Wiki to showcase their body of work. Author pages contain a list of all pages published by a given author, and act as a way for readers to easily find more works by a given author. Author pages are subject to rating, but not to deletion, and may contain whatever their author likes in addition to a list of their works.

[[collapsible show="+ Adding your author page to this list" hide="- Adding your author page to this list"]]

If you've authored[[footnote]]This includes pages on the SCP Wiki written by you, either by yourself or co-authored. Contributions to collaborative pages do not count.[[/footnote]] or translated from another language **__at least three__** pages with a rating of +0 or more (including SCP articles, GoI format documents, Site dossiers, Joke pages, tales, artwork pages, essays and guides), please take the time to create an author page and take credit for your work. Create and tweak as you desire, and add yourself to the list below **alphabetically** by your Wikidot username.

The format for your slot is:

[[div class="code"]]
@@|| [[*user YOUR-USERNAME]] || [[[AUTHOR-PAGE-LINK | ]]] ||@@
[[/div]]

For example, if your username is 'The Administrator' and your author page URL is 'the-administrator-s-biography':

[[div class="code"]]
@@|| [[*user The Administrator]] || [[[the-administrator-s-biography | ]]] ||@@
[[/div]]

If you have any questions or concerns regarding Author Pages, or need help adding your information to this, please [[[contact-staff|contact staff]]].
[[/collapsible]]

[[collapsible show="+ Tips for creating an author page" hide="- Tips for creating an author page"]]
A low-maintenance author page can be created using [https://www.wikidot.com/doc-modules:listpages-module Wikidot's ListPages module] to automatically list pages created by you. However, bear in mind that ListPages can only automatically list pages that you created - it doesn't know about co-authors!

See our in-depth guide on how to use ListPages: [[[listpages magic and you | ]]]

Or, consider a component to make the process even easier:

* [[[author-page-tool | ]]]
* [[[component:mega-cool-author-page-tool | ]]]
[[/collapsible]]
[[collapsible show="+ Author will policy" hide="- Author will policy"]]
In the event an author leaves the community they may choose a person or persons to leave their articles to. This must be posted either on their author page or the dedicated thread. These wills define a designated user or users who will manage their articles without them.

These wills also define a period of inactivity, this will be measured from the last activity on wikidot or any staff controlled space (official discord or IRC), a good faith attempt to reach out to them must be first attempted. Alternatively if the user has been permanently banned from the wiki that date can be used.

Firstly custodianship of an article means the designated user is the point of contact for staff related questions and edits for a work, see image replacement, wikiwalk edits and technical issues.

Secondly passing control or ownership over means that the designated user in addition to being the custodian is allowed to make major edits to a work. A major edit here is defined as a significant change to the work that does not change the themes or core narrative of a work. All major edits must be approved by rewrite before being applied to ensure that the changes do not rise to being a full rewrite of an article. They are also allowed to make minor edits without consulting rewrite. Minor edits must be constrained to small portions of the text and cannot change the narrative of a work.

An author can state that the designated user with ownership/control cannot make major changes, this will limit them to making minor changes. Alternatively the author can specify that the designated user has full rewrite permissions, this will allow them to totally rewrite the articles transferred.

An author can choose different users for different works. However all co authored works will not be transferred to non coauthored users unless none of the coauthors can be contacted. Transferring ownership, control or custodianship to a coauthor does nothing.

Some users has stated that they want to transfer ownership or control to the community then this means nothing for most of the articles with the following exceptions: Firstly all articles by the author below +10 can be rewritten if they are gone. 

A) Hubs which staff inherit due to the inactivity of the original author(s) may receive minor edits from staff (Navigational edits, fixing themes, fixing broken images) with oversight and approval from Rewrite. Addition of links to new relevant works would be considered a minor edit.
B) Rewrite may review requests to assign a guarantor/maintainer to hubs inherited due to author inactivity. (This includes but is not limited to Canon and GoI hubs inherited in this manner).
B1) These guarantors/maintainers will be allowed to update/rework a hub to respect the original intent/content of the hub while implementing modern standards, with Rewrite's oversight.
C) Hubs given to the community are subject to staff modification/updating/maintenance with review/oversight from the Rewrite team. Rewrite team may assign a guarantor/maintainer, but anyone may request to make major edits to these hubs.
[[/collapsible]]
[[/div]]

[[=]]
+* Authors' Pages
